textbooks.title: An Introduction to Statistical Learning with Applications in R

topics: Linear Methods for Regression and Regularization
Basis Expansions and Generalized Additive Models
Basis Expansions and Generalized Additive Models
Sequential data (time series): Hidden Markov models

grading.policies: The grade may be curved more leniently based on student outcome.

policies.late_work: 10% penalty for each late day: No assignments accepted after 2 days. 50% penalty for missing each one of the files: pdf/html or ipynb.
policies.academic_integrity: You cannot share ideas in any written form: code, pseudocode or solutions. You cannot submit someone else's work found through internet or any other source.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology is dedicated to providing appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.course_format: The class will combine class presentations, discussions, and exercises.
additional_info.technology_requirements: Python is the main software package that will be used. Recommended to install the Anaconda distribution.
additional_info.support_resources: Office of Counseling and Psychological Services (CAPS) offers free and confidential services.

course_info.title: Advanced Data Analytics and Machine Learning

_metadata.course_description: The significant amount of corporate information available requires a systematic and analytical approach to select the most important information and anticipate major events.
learning_outcomes: Understand the foundations of statistical learning algorithms
Apply statistical models and analytical methods to several business domains using a statistical language.
Recognize the value and also the limits of statistical learning algorithms to solve business problems.
Written and oral communications skills: students are required to communicate properly during the class discussions.
Solve a major analytical problem using large datasets in a project and communicate its results in a professional way.
